column4: US STOCKS-Wall St edges up on Syria delay  bets on Fed policy
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 11 U.S. stocks edged higher on Wednesday  lifting the S&P 500 for its seventh straight day of gains  as concern over a possible U.S.-led strike on Syria ebbed and investors bet the Federal Reserve would trim its stimulus measures only slightly.

The senior unsecured notes are fully and unconditionally  guaranteed by Arcos Dorados B.V. (AD) and relevant operating companies. column4: Trial begins against BP over Texas refinery emissions
column5: HOUSTON Trial began on Wednesday in the first four of 48 000 civil lawsuits filed against BP Plc for pollution from the 460 196 barrel per day (bpd) refinery it owned in Texas City  Texas until early this year  according to court documents.

column5: SEOUL/LONDON Baghdad signed a deal in early September for BP  to revive Iraq's northern Kirkuk oilfield  Oil Minister Abdul Kareem Luaibi said on Wednesday  confirming a plan that Kurdistan has already rejected as illegal.

column4: Moonves says CBS didn't take financial hit from channel blackout
column5: LOS ANGELES  Sept 11 CBS Corp suffered no financial impact from the month-long blackout of its broadcast channel in New York  Los Angeles and Dallas during its stalemate with Time Warner Cable in a rate dispute  according to CBS Chief Executive Leslie Moonves.

column4: Chesapeake settles with Pennsylvania landowners in royalty lawsuit
column5: Chesapeake Energy Corp  has agreed to pay $7.5 million to settle a class-action lawsuit with Pennsylvania landowners who said the natural gas producer was deducting large fees from their royalty checks.

column5: CARACAS Venezuela and Trinidad and Tobago said that Venezuela's state oil company PDVSA will work with U.S. company Chevron  to develop an offshore natural gas field  one of three that span the Caribbean countries' maritime border.

column4: Venezuela and Trinidad agree to offshore Chevron gas deal

column4: Chevron eyes tight LNG market  less China shale gas overall
column5: Sept 11 The liquefied natural gas market looks to be tight in the years ahead given a shortage of new projects lined up  partly due to rising costs as demand for contractors to do the work has surged  Chevron Corp's vice chairman said on Wednesday.

column4: US Airways  American defend planned merger in court filing
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 10 US Airways defended its proposed merger with American Airlines on Tuesday  arguing that the deal would create $500 million in savings to consumers annually by building a stronger competitor to Delta Air Lines Inc and United Continental.

column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 11 Deutsche Bank's  supervisory board is to discuss the option of extending co-Chief Executive Juergen Fitschen's term of office  two people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: EOG Resources expects to increase its natgas production -CEO

column5: Sept 11 IT outsourcing company iGate Corp  named Ashok Vemuri as its chief executive  nearly four months after sacking its then CEO Phaneesh Murthy over an undisclosed relationship with a subordinate.

column4: International Paper to close Alabama mill  lay off 1 100
column5: International Paper Co  said it will close its Courtland  Alabama  paper mill by early next year  laying off 1 100 workers.

column5: Sept 11 International Paper Co said it will close its Courtland  Alabama  paper mill by early next year  laying off 1 100 workers.

column4: KKR  Sycamore consider joint bid for retailer Jones Group: WSJ
column5: Private-equity firms KKR & Co LP  and Sycamore Partners are considering a joint bid for Jones Group   the fashion and footwear company that owns retail chains Nine West and Jones New York  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: KKR  Sycamore consider joint bid for retailer Jones Group - WSJ
column5: Sept 11 Private-equity firms KKR & Co LP  and Sycamore Partners are considering a joint bid for Jones Group  the fashion and footwear company that owns retail chains Nine West and Jones New York  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing people familiar with the matter.

column4: Legg Mason says reorganization steps to cost $20 million
column5: BOSTON Legg Mason Inc on Wednesday said reorganization steps will cost it a total of $20 million for severance and other expenses in the quarters ending in September and December.

column4: UPDATE 2-UK watchdog clears way for Lloyds share sale
column5: * Decision removes barrier to Lloyds share sale - sources

column4: RPT-UK watchdog backs plans for Lloyds  RBS branch sales
column5: LONDON  Sept 11 Britain's competition regulator has approved planned branch sales by Lloyds Banking Group  and Royal Bank of Scotland to increase choice for consumers in a step towards the government selling its shares in the banks.

column4: BRIEF-Lloyds agrees changes to TSB structure  profits
column5: Sept 11 Lloyds Banking Group PLC :  * Agreement with hmt regarding tsb  * Lloyds Banking Group announces agreement with her majesty's treasury

column4: Lockheed acquires Amor group as part of global expansion plan
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp  on Wednesday announced the acquisition of Scotland-based Amor Group  a privately held information technology company  saying the deal would aid its plans to expand internationally and into non-defense markets.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. Navy says all weapon programs under budget reviews
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 11 U.S. Navy Secretary Ray Mabus said all Navy and Marine Corps weapons programs were being examined for possible cuts or cancellation if mandatory  across-the-board budget cuts remained in effect in coming years.

column4: Magellan seeks partner to build condensate splitter in Texas
column5: HOUSTON Magellan Midstream Partners  is considering seeking a partner to build a condensate splitter in Corpus Christi  Texas  to process condensate moved from the Eagle Ford shale oil play on its joint-venture Double Eagle pipeline  Chief Executive Mike Mears told analysts on Wednesday.

column4: AstraZeneca pays $50 million for rights to Merck cancer drug
column5: Merck & Co Inc has licensed its experimental cancer drug to AstraZeneca Plc for a $50 million upfront fee in a deal that shows Britain's second-biggest drugmaker continuing to rebuild its pipeline.

column4: Celebrity designer Kors plays up signature looks at Fashion Week
column5: NEW YORK Designers from the celebrity world put modern touches to classics on the runways on Wednesday as New York Fashion Week was drawing to a close.

column4: UPDATE 2-Software company Veeva files for IPO of up to $150 mln
column5: * Morgan Stanley and Deutsche Bank Securities lead underwriters

column4: Bids for patch maker LTS Lohmann due late October - sources
column5: FRANKFURT  Sept 11 The first bids for German medical skin patch maker LTS Lohmann are due in the second half of October  three people familiar with the sale told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: Motorola now shipping 100 000 Moto X phones weekly from Texas
column5: FORT WORTH  Texas Motorola is shipping 100 000 of its new Moto X phones weekly from a manufacturing facility near Dallas  a modest start for a made-in-the-USA phone that marks the most significant effort to revive the iconic company after Google Inc bought it last year.

column4: REFILE-Motorola now shipping 100 000 Moto X phones weekly from Texas

column4: RPT-DoCoMo's iPhone offer turns up the heat on Japanese handset makers
column5: TOKYO  Sept 11 The decision by Japanese mobile carriers to offer the newly unveiled 5C  a lower-end handset that was expected to be released only in emerging markets  will likely seal the fate of troubled Japanese handset makers as it erases their price advantage.

column4: DoCoMo's iPhone offer turns up the heat on Japanese handset makers

column4: Ben Ainslie could replace Oracle tactician in America's Cup
column5: SAN FRANCISCO A blunder on Tuesday that led to a commanding victory for Emirates Team Zealand and prompted Oracle Team USA to call an unusual time-out in the 34th America's Cup regatta might have cost sailor John Kostecki his job.

column4: Sailing-Ben Ainslie could replace Oracle tactician in America's Cup

column4: Oracle calls time out in America's Cup after Kiwi trouncing
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Embattled defending champion Oracle Team USA postponed a second America's Cup race on Tuesday  saying it needed to regroup after Emirates Team New Zealand won its fourth commanding victory on San Francisco Bay.

column4: Pandora names former Microsoft executive Brian McAndrews as CEO
column5: Sept 11 Pandora Media Inc on Wednesday named former Microsoft Corp executive and venture capitalist Brian McAndrews as president  chairman and CEO.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 1-PetroChina  Shell's $13 bln refinery stalls on land issue-sources
PetroChina  Shell's $13 billion refinery stalls on land issue: sources
column5: BEIJING Plans for a $13 billion refinery and petrochemical complex in east China have stalled over finding a suitable site for the plant  which could face long-term delays  industry and government officials said.

column4: UPDATE 1-PetroChina partner China Oil & Gas denies former executive under investigation
column5: HONG KONG  Sept 11 China Oil & Gas Group Ltd   a joint venture partner with state-owned PetroChina   on Wednesday denied a newspaper report that one of its former executives was being investigated as part of a corruption probe.

column5: * Phillips 66 building own rail facility at Washington refinery

column4: TSX steady as bank  energy shares offset Potash Corp drop
column5: TORONTO  Sept 11 Canada's main stock index was little changed on Wednesday with weakness in Potash Corp of Saskatchewan was offset by gains in shares of financial and energy companies.     The Toronto Stock Exchange's S&P/TSX composite index  unofficially closed up 0.94 points  or 0.01 percent  at 12 825.42. Six of the 10 main sectors on the index were in the red.

column4: RPT-UK watchdog backs plans for Lloyds  RBS branch sales
column5: LONDON  Sept 11 Britain's competition regulator has approved planned branch sales by Lloyds Banking Group  and Royal Bank of Scotland to increase choice for consumers in a step towards the government selling its shares in the banks.

column4: Top hedge fund in bid to shape up Sotheby's
column5: BOSTON Hedge fund manager Mick McGuire is not an art collector and has never felt the thrill of bidding in a Sotheby's  auction  where adrenaline spikes with each multimillion-dollar sale of a Cezanne  Rothko or Picasso.

column4: From dollar bills to butterflies  Warhol sale to set Hong Kong aflutter
column5: HONG KONG More than 40 works by pop artist Andy Warhol will be displayed at an exhibition hosted by the auction house Sotheby's in Hong Kong  with the most expensive piece valued at about $1 million.

column4: Suncor planned maintenance reducing synthetic crude output
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Sept 11 Synthetic crude production at Suncor Energy Inc's northern Alberta oil sands operations has been reduced by 50 000 to 60 000 barrels per day as the company carries out planned maintenance on an upgrader vacuum tower  its chief executive said at an investment conference on Wednesday.

column4: Telefonica mulls offer for Telecom Italia shareholders: source
column5: MADRID Telefonica  is studying different options to buy out fellow investors in Telecom Italia  without the Spanish group adding to its own substantial debt burden  a source familiar with the situation told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telefonica mulls offer for Telecom Italia shareholders -source
column5: MADRID  Sept 11 Telefonica is studying different options to buy out fellow investors in Telecom Italia  without the Spanish group adding to its own substantial debt burden  a source familiar with the situation told Reuters on Wednesday.

column5: MILAN  Sept 11 Shares in Telecom Italia  accelerated gains after a source said Spain's Telefonica was studying an offer for the Italian incumbent's core shareholders without raising debt.

column4: Telefonica mulls offer for Telecom Italia shareholders: source
column5: MADRID Telefonica is studying an offer to help fellow investors in Telecom Italia sell their stakes in the Italian firm in a way that would not result in more debt for the Spanish telecoms company  a source familiar with the situation told Reuters on Wednesday.

column4: Telefonica sees signs of turnaround in Spanish business
column5: MADRID Telecoms group Telefonica expects see an uptick in clients and revenues soon in Spain  which would mark the start of a turnaround in its weak home market.

column4: Bayview Mortgage Capital withdraws IPO plans
column5: Sept 11 Bayview Mortgage Capital Inc  which has links to private equity firm Blackstone Group LP  said it has decided to withdraw its initial public offering plan  four years after the REIT filed for an IPO of up to $500 million.

column4: G.S. Electech executive indicted in U.S. for price fixing
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 11 An executive with Japanese auto parts company G.S. Electech Inc has been indicted for allegedly fixing prices and rigging bids for parts in some antilock brake systems installed in U.S. cars  the Justice Department said on Wednesday.

column4: Honda to sell cheap green car Brio Satya in Indonesia in November
column5: TOKYO  Sept 11 Honda Motor Co will start selling its new small hatchback Brio Satya in November in Indonesia where it expects the vehicle to be certified by the government as a tax-exempt  low-cost green car.

column4: US Airways  AMR seek an extension for merger: report
column5: US Airways Group Inc LLC and American Airlines parent AMR Corp said they would ask their boards to extend the termination date of their proposed $11 billion merger due to uncertainties related to a government lawsuit  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing sources.

column4: US Airways  American defend planned merger in court filing
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 10 US Airways defended its proposed merger with American Airlines on Tuesday  arguing that the deal would create $500 million in savings to consumers annually by building a stronger competitor to Delta Air Lines Inc and United Continental.

column4: Verizon bond demand causes CDS-bond distortion
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 11 (IFR) - The massive US$101bn demand for Verizon Communications' US$49bn bond that priced on Wednesday caused an optical distortion in the company's underlying CDS versus its cash bonds.

column4: Walmart U.S. CEO 'amazed' by shoppers' resilience
column5: NEW YORK U.S. consumers are ready to shop this Halloween  Thanksgiving and Christmas as they "find a way to navigate" through a continued difficult economy  Walmart U.S. Chief Executive Bill Simon said on Wednesday.

column4: Disney delays 'Pirates' sequel after pushing up 'Ant-Man'
column5: Sept 10 Los AnglesWalt Disney Co said on Tuesday that it would delay the release of the film "Pirates of the Caribbean 5 " the latest in the blockbuster series starring Johnny Depp. The movie had been scheduled to open in theaters on July 10  2015.

column4: UPDATE 1-California city backs plan to seize negative equity mortgages
column5: RICHMOND  Calif  Sept 11 Richmond  California's leaders approved on Wednesday morning a plan for the city to become the first in the nation to acquire mortgages with negative equity in a bid to keep local residents in their homes.

column4: Imperial says Kearl oil sands project producing 50 000-60 000 bpd
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  Sept 11 Imperial Oil Ltd's  Kearl oil sands project in northern Alberta is producing 50 000 to 60 000 barrels per day and aims to reach full capacity of 110 000 bpd later in 2013  a company spokesman told Reuters on Wednesday.
